gobblin.config.store.api

Interface ConfigStore

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ConfigStoreWithBatchFetches, ConfigStoreWithImportedBy, ConfigStoreWithImportedByRecursively, ConfigStoreWithResolution

    @Alpha
public interface ConfigStore
    The ConfigStore interface used to describe a configuration store. A configuration store is a responsible for:
    • Storing and fetching the values for configuration keys
    • Storing and fetching the tags for configuration keys
    • Maintaining different versions of the above mappings
    This API defines the minimum functionality that a store has to implement. There are also a number of additional APIS (such as ConfigStoreWithBatchFetches, ConfigStoreWithImportedBy, ConfigStoreWithImportedByRecursively, ConfigStoreWithResolution, ConfigStoreWithStableVersioning) that denote that the store supports additional operations efficiently and the config client library should delegate those to the store rather than implementing those itself.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentVersion

        String getCurrentVersion()
        Returns:
        the current version for that configuration store.

      • getStoreURI

        URI getStoreURI()
        Obtains the config store root URI. This typically represents the physical location of the store. It may contain the server name and the path to the physical location of the store.
        Returns:
        the configuration store root URI .

      • getChildren

        Collection<ConfigKeyPath> getChildren(ConfigKeyPath configKey,
                                      String version)
                               throws VersionDoesNotExistException
        Obtains the direct children config keys for a given config key. For example, the child paths for /data/tracking may be /data/tracking/ImpressionEvent and /data/tracking/ClickEvent .

        Note that this method should not be used for "service discovery", i.e. it need not return all possible child paths but only those defined in the store. For example, the configuration for /data/tracking/ConversionEvent may be implicitly inherited from /data/tracking and /data/tracking/ConversionEvent may not be returned by this method.

        Parameters:
        configKey - the config key path whose children are necessary.
        version - specify the configuration version in the configuration store.
        Returns:
        the direct children config key paths
        Throws:
        VersionDoesNotExistException - if the requested config version does not exist (any longer)

      • getOwnImports

        List<ConfigKeyPath> getOwnImports(ConfigKeyPath configKey,
                                  String version)
                           throws VersionDoesNotExistException
        Obtains the list of all config keys with which are given config key is tagged/annotated.
        Parameters:
        configKey - the config key path whose tags are needed
        version - the configuration version in the configuration store.
        Returns:
        the paths of the directly imported config keys for the specified config key and version. Note that order is significant the earlier ConfigKeyPath in the List will have higher priority when resolving configuration conflicts.
        Throws:
        VersionDoesNotExistException - if the requested config version does not exist (any longer)

      • getOwnConfig

        Config getOwnConfig(ConfigKeyPath configKey,
                    String version)
             throws VersionDoesNotExistException
        Obtains the configuration properties directly associated with a given config keys. These will not include any properties/values which can be obtained from the ancestors or imported config keys.
        Parameters:
        configKey - the config key path whose properties are needed.
        version - the configuration version in the configuration store.
        Returns:
        the directly specified configuration in Config format for input uri against input configuration version
        Throws:
        VersionDoesNotExistException - if the requested config version does not exist (any longer)
